Title: Death of Eric Garner
Description: Eric Garner uttered 'I can’t breathe' 11 times as NYPD Officer Daniel Pantaleo pinned him, leading to Garner’s death. Pantaleo was fired, and Garner’s family received a $5.9 million settlement.

Title: Death of Michael Brown
Description: Michael Brown was shot to death by Ferguson, Missouri police officer Darren Wilson, sparking civil unrest.

Title: Death of Tamir Rice
Description: 12-year-old Tamir Rice was shot and killed by Cleveland police over a toy gun. His family received a $6 million settlement.

Title: Death of Eric Harris
Description: Eric Harris was shot in the back and killed in Tulsa, Oklahoma by Reserve Deputy Robert Charles Bates, who was convicted of manslaughter.

Title: Death of Walter Scott
Description: Walter Scott was shot in the back by North Charleston police officer Michael Slager, who was convicted of murder.

Title: Death of Freddie Gray
Description: Freddie Gray died from a severe spinal injury in Baltimore police custody. His family received a $6.4 million settlement.

Title: Death of Alton Sterling
Description: Alton Sterling was shot by Baton Rouge police. His family settled a wrongful death lawsuit for $4.5 million.

Title: Death of Philando Castile
Description: Philando Castile was shot during a traffic stop in Minnesota. His family received a $3.8 million settlement.

Title: Death of Stephon Clark
Description: Stephon Clark was shot in Sacramento, California by police who mistook his cell phone for a gun.

Title: Death of Botham Jean
Description: Botham Jean was shot by off-duty police officer Amber Guyger in his own apartment. Guyger was convicted of murder.

Title: Death of Breonna Taylor
Description: Breonna Taylor was shot eight times by police during a raid. Her family received a $12 million settlement.

Title: Death of George Floyd
Description: George Floyd was killed by Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, who knelt on Floyd's neck. Floyd’s family settled for $27 million.

Title: Death of Daunte Wright
Description: Daunte Wright was shot by officer Kim Potter during a traffic stop. Potter was convicted of manslaughter.

Title: Death of Patrick Lyoya
Description: Patrick Lyoya was shot by a Grand Rapids police officer during a scuffle. The case was under investigation.

Title: Deepwater Horizon oil rig explosion
Description: The Deepwater Horizon oil rig exploded, causing a massive oil spill.

Title: Osama bin Laden's death announced
Description: Osama bin Laden was killed by U.S. forces in Pakistan.

Title: Aurora movie theater shooting
Description: A shooter opened fire in a movie theater in Aurora, Colorado.

Title: Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting
Description: A gunman killed 26 at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut.

Title: Boston Marathon bombing
Description: Two bombs exploded near the finish line of the Boston Marathon.

Title: Shooting of Michael Brown
Description: Michael Brown's shooting led to protests and national debate on police violence.

Title: Charleston church shooting
Description: A gunman killed nine in a racially motivated attack at a Charleston church.

Title: San Bernardino attack
Description: A terrorist attack in San Bernardino, California, left 14 dead.

Title: Pulse nightclub shooting
Description: A mass shooting at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida.

Title: Women's March
Description: Millions marched in the Women's March the day after the presidential inauguration.

Title: Charlottesville rally
Description: A rally in Charlottesville, Virginia, turned deadly.

Title: Las Vegas shooting
Description: A gunman opened fire on a Las Vegas concert, the deadliest mass shooting in modern U.S. history.

Title: Stoneman Douglas High School shooting
Description: Seventeen people were killed in a shooting at Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Florida.

Title: El Paso shooting
Description: A gunman killed 23 people in a racially motivated attack at a Walmart in El Paso, Texas.

Title: COVID-19 widespread lockdowns begin
Description: The COVID-19 pandemic led to widespread lockdowns beginning in March 2020, significantly impacting daily life globally.

Title: Shooting of Jacob Blake
Description: Jacob Blake was shot by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin, leading to widespread protests.

Title: Storming of the US Capitol
Description: Supporters of President Donald Trump stormed the US Capitol, leading to deaths, injuries, and significant political upheaval.

Title: Emergence of Omicron variant
Description: The Omicron variant of COVID-19 led to concerns of another wave of the pandemic.

Title: Uvalde school shooting
Description: A mass shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, left 21 dead, sparking renewed debates over gun control.
